title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0162

segments.en: Hello, everyone.
segments.cn: 大家好。

segments.en: Welcome back to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 欢迎回到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: And my name is Catherine.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine。

segments.en: And today we are talking about an important holiday the world over.
segments.cn: 今天我们要谈论一个全球重要的节日。

segments.en: It's very important all over the world, especially in the United States.
segments.cn: 这个节日在全世界都很重要，尤其是在美国。

segments.en: So let's take a look at this holiday in vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 那么让我们先看看这个节日的词汇预览。

segments.en: Vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 词汇预览。

segments.en: So the name of the holiday is Veterans Day.
segments.cn: 这个节日的名字是退伍军人节。

segments.en: So, veteran.
segments.cn: 所以，退伍军人。

segments.en: So what's a veteran?
segments.cn: 退伍军人是什么？

segments.en: A veteran is a person who has participated in a war or in some kind of military situation.
segments.cn: 退伍军人是指参与过战争或某种军事情况的人。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So Veterans Day is a day where you commemorate all the people that fought in the different wars.
segments.cn: 退伍军人节是一个纪念所有在不同战争中作战的人的日子。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: A veteran doesn't have to be a World War II veteran.
segments.cn: 退伍军人不一定是二战退伍军人。

segments.en: They could be a Civil War veteran or a Vietnam War veteran.
segments.cn: 他们可以是内战退伍军人或越南战争退伍军人。

segments.en: Just a general term.
segments.cn: 只是一个通用术语。

segments.en: Or a Gulf War.
segments.cn: 或者是海湾战争的退伍军人。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So that's the day in the United States where everyone honors all the soldiers that participated in different wars and they fought for their country.
segments.cn: 所以在美国，这是一个大家都尊敬参与不同战争并为国家而战的士兵的日子。

segments.en: Mm -hmm.
segments.cn: 嗯-嗯。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So why don't we take a look at our dialogue for the first time and we'll be back.
segments.cn: 那么我们为什么不第一次看看我们的对话，然后再回来。

segments.en: Do you have any plans for Veterans Day?
segments.cn: 你有退伍军人节的计划吗？

segments.en: You mean Armistice Day?
segments.cn: 你是说停战日吗？

segments.en: What are you talking about?
segments.cn: 你在说什么？

segments.en: November 11th is Veterans Day.
segments.cn: 11月11日是退伍军人节。

segments.en: What planet are you from?
segments.cn: 你来自哪个星球？

segments.en: Well, as you know, on November 11th, the Allies signed a peace treaty with the Germans, also known as the Armistice Treaty.
segments.cn: 嗯，正如你所知，11月11日，盟军与德国签署了和平条约，也称为停战条约。

segments.en: This marked the end of World War I and many countries around the world commemorated this date under names such as Remembrance Day.
segments.cn: 这标志着第一次世界大战的结束，世界许多国家以纪念日等名称纪念这个日期。

segments.en: In Poland, it's their Independence Day.
segments.cn: 在波兰，这是他们的独立日。

segments.en: There's a lot going on around the world on this day.
segments.cn: 在这一天，世界各地发生了很多事情。

segments.en: Wow.
segments.cn: 哇。

segments.en: I didn't know.
segments.cn: 我不知道。

segments.en: Probably because I flunked history in school.
segments.cn: 可能是因为我在学校历史课不及格。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So there's a lot of really great vocabulary in this elementary lesson.
segments.cn: 所以在这节基础课中有很多很棒的词汇。

segments.en: So let's take a look at some of these words and phrases in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 那么让我们看看这些词汇和短语在语言收获中。

segments.en: Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 语言收获。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So the first word that came up after the guy mentioned Veterans Day, the girl mentioned Armistice Day.
segments.cn: 所以在提到退伍军人节后，第一个出现的词是停战日。

segments.en: Armistice.
segments.cn: 停战。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So what is this Armistice Day?
segments.cn: 那么这个停战日是什么？

segments.en: Armistice means to stop fighting, right?
segments.cn: 停战意味着停止战斗，对吗？

segments.en: So it's a time in which people lay down their arms, we say.
segments.cn: 所以这是人们放下武器的时刻，我们说。

segments.en: And it's one that's celebrated in Commonwealth countries like England or Canada and in parts of Europe.
segments.cn: 这是在英联邦国家如英国或加拿大以及欧洲部分地区庆祝的日子。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: So Armistice Day, kind of like the equivalent for Commonwealth countries to Veterans Day.
segments.cn: 所以停战日，类似于英联邦国家的退伍军人节。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: And well, the girl gave him a bit of a history lesson and mentioned that on November 11th, the Allies signed a peace treaty.
segments.cn: 而且，女孩给了他一点历史课，提到11月11日，盟军签署了和平条约。

segments.en: So we have two great words here, allies.
segments.cn: 所以我们有两个很棒的词，盟军。

segments.en: So allies is a word that we use in English to indicate people who fought against the Germans, Italians, and Japanese in World War II.
segments.cn: 所以盟军是我们在英语中用来指代在二战中与德国、意大利和日本作战的人。

segments.en: So allies include Great Britain, America, France for some time.
segments.cn: 所以盟军包括大不列颠、美国、法国一段时间。

segments.en: So these are countries that were, and Russia, they were fighting against the Germans.
segments.cn: 这些国家，以及俄罗斯，他们是与德国作战的。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So in general terms, an ally is a friend, right?
segments.cn: 所以一般来说，盟友是朋友，对吗？

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So Marco and I are allies.
segments.cn: 所以Marco和我是盟友。

segments.en: If there's a fight, I'm on his side.
segments.cn: 如果有争斗，我站在他这一边。

segments.en: The opposite of enemies.
segments.cn: 敌人的对立面。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: And well, the Allies signed a peace treaty.
segments.cn: 而且，盟军签署了和平条约。

segments.en: So what is a peace treaty?
segments.cn: 那么和平条约是什么？

segments.en: A treaty is a document that outlines new rules for a situation.
segments.cn: 条约是概述情况新规则的文件。

segments.en: And a peace treaty is a document that calls for peace.
segments.cn: 和平条约是呼吁和平的文件。

segments.en: It says we will not fight anymore.
segments.cn: 它说我们将不再战斗。

segments.en: We will have peace.
segments.cn: 我们将拥有和平。

segments.en: And this is this is what this means.
segments.cn: 这就是它的意思。

segments.en: So we have new rules.
segments.cn: 所以我们有新的规则。

segments.en: So it's an agreement.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个协议。

segments.en: It's like a contract.
segments.cn: 这就像是一个合同。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: It's a contract between nations.
segments.cn: 这是国家之间的合同。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: And as we mentioned, Veterans Day or Armistice Day, we commemorate these events that happened in the past.
segments.cn: 正如我们提到的，退伍军人节或停战日，我们纪念这些发生在过去的事件。

segments.en: So to commemorate something, right, so in a sense, we are honoring it.
segments.cn: 所以纪念某事，对吧，从某种意义上说，我们是在尊敬它。

segments.en: So to commemorate is to remember to honor to remember with respect.
segments.cn: 所以纪念就是以尊重的方式记住。

segments.en: So yeah, to remember with respect.
segments.cn: 所以是的，以尊重的方式记住。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: There's a there's a positive respectful tone here.
segments.cn: 这里有一种积极的尊重的语气。

segments.en: It's remembering for a good reason.
segments.cn: 这是为了一个好的理由而记住。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: So we've taken a look at these four words.
segments.cn: 所以我们已经看过这四个词。

segments.en: Why don't we listen to our dialogue again?
segments.cn: 我们为什么不再听一次我们的对话？

segments.en: And we'll be back in a bit to look at Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 然后我们稍后再回来看看流利度提升。

segments.en: Do you have any plans for Veterans Day?
segments.cn: 你有退伍军人节的计划吗？

segments.en: You mean Armistice Day?
segments.cn: 你是说停战日吗？

segments.en: What are you talking about?
segments.cn: 你在说什么？

segments.en: November 11 is Veterans Day.
segments.cn: 11月11日是退伍军人节。

segments.en: What planet are you from?
segments.cn: 你来自哪个星球？

segments.en: Well, as you know, on November 11, the Allies signed a peace treaty with the Germans, also known as the Armistice Treaty.
segments.cn: 嗯，正如你所知，11月11日，盟军与德国签署了和平条约，也称为停战条约。

segments.en: This marked the end of World War One and many countries around the world commemorated this date and the name such as Remembrance Day.
segments.cn: 这标志着第一次世界大战的结束，世界许多国家以纪念日等名称纪念这个日期。

segments.en: In Poland, it's their Independence Day.
segments.cn: 在波兰，这是他们的独立日。

segments.en: There's a lot going on around the world on this day.
segments.cn: 在这一天，世界各地发生了很多事情。

segments.en: Wow, I didn't know.
segments.cn: 哇，我不知道。

segments.en: Probably because I flunked history in school.
segments.cn: 可能是因为我在学校历史课不及格。

segments.en: Today's Fluency Builder includes a couple of really interesting phrases that are kind of longer.
segments.cn: 今天的流利度提升包含了一些非常有趣的短语，稍微长一点。

segments.en: So let's take a look at the first one, which is very, very common in English.
segments.cn: 所以我们来看看第一个，这在英语中非常常见。

segments.en: Alright, so this first sentence was kind of using a sarcastic tone because he said, What are you talking about?
segments.cn: 好吧，这第一个句子有点讽刺的语气，因为他说，你在说什么？

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So this guy says, Veterans Day?
segments.cn: 所以这个家伙说，退伍军人日？

segments.en: Oh, you mean Armistice Day?
segments.cn: 哦，你是说停战日？

segments.en: What are you talking about?
segments.cn: 你在说什么？

segments.en: That means No, I mean, Veterans Day.
segments.cn: 这意味着不，我是说，退伍军人日。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So he wasn't really asking, like, what are you talking about?
segments.cn: 所以他并不是在真正问，你在说什么？

segments.en: He was literally saying with this sentence, are you crazy?
segments.cn: 他实际上是在用这个句子说，你疯了吗？

segments.en: Or like, you're wrong.
segments.cn: 或者说，你错了。

segments.en: You're wrong.
segments.cn: 你错了。

segments.en: So what are you talking about?
segments.cn: 所以你在说什么？

segments.en: is a way very sarcastic way to say, Listen, I think you're wrong, or you must be a little bit crazy.
segments.cn: 是一种非常讽刺的方式说，听着，我觉得你错了，或者你可能有点疯狂。

segments.en: Right?
segments.cn: 对吧？

segments.en: What are you talking about?
segments.cn: 你在说什么？

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: And then to end the whole sarcastic sentence there, he said, What planet are you from?
segments.cn: 然后为了结束整个讽刺的句子，他说，你来自哪个星球？

segments.en: So obviously, this is Veterans Day.
segments.cn: 所以显然，这是退伍军人日。

segments.en: What planet are you from?
segments.cn: 你来自哪个星球？

segments.en: So you're so wrong.
segments.cn: 所以你是如此错误。

segments.en: How do you not understand what this is?
segments.cn: 你怎么会不明白这是什么？

segments.en: How do you not know this?
segments.cn: 你怎么会不知道这个？

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: And so for example, I could say, maybe I'll ask you, Marco, who's the President of the United States?
segments.cn: 例如，我可以说，也许我会问你，马尔科，美国总统是谁？

segments.en: All right, I can say, Well, what planet are you from?
segments.cn: 好吧，我可以说，嗯，你来自哪个星球？

segments.en: It's obviously President Obama.
segments.cn: 显然是奥巴马总统。

segments.en: Oh, duh.
segments.cn: 哦，呃。

segments.en: So it's like, obviously, everybody knows this.
segments.cn: 所以这就像，显然，大家都知道这个。

segments.en: So you're saying, how do you not like, how do you not know this already?
segments.cn: 所以你在说，你怎么会不知道这个？

segments.en: So it's very sarcastic.
segments.cn: 所以这非常讽刺。

segments.en: What planet are you from?
segments.cn: 你来自哪个星球？

segments.en: And finally, the guy is talking about how he doesn't understand what the meaning of Veterans Day is.
segments.cn: 最后，这个家伙在谈论他不理解退伍军人日的意义。

segments.en: And after this long explanation, he says, Well, I didn't know, probably because I flunked history in school.
segments.cn: 在这长篇解释后，他说，嗯，我不知道，可能是因为我在学校历史课不及格。

segments.en: So if you flunked history, or you flunked any subject in school, it means you didn't pass.
segments.cn: 所以如果你在历史课不及格，或者在学校的任何科目不及格，意味着你没有通过。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So flunked, to flunk is a verb in English, and it means to fail a subject.
segments.cn: 所以不及格，flunk是英语中的一个动词，意思是未通过一门科目。

segments.en: That means maybe in 100% is perfect, you got 50% or 40%, and you have to take the course again.
segments.cn: 这意味着也许在100%是完美的情况下，你得了50%或40%，你必须重新修这门课。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Did you ever flunk an exam in school?
segments.cn: 你在学校有不及格过考试吗？

segments.en: No, no, really, you didn't never know.
segments.cn: 不，不，真的，你从来没有。

segments.en: Wow, such a good student.
segments.cn: 哇，真是个好学生。

segments.en: Did you?
segments.cn: 你呢？

segments.en: Maybe I did maybe once or twice.
segments.cn: 也许我有过，一两次。

segments.en: I was much too self critical.
segments.cn: 我对自己太过苛刻。

segments.en: All right, let's listen to this dialogue again.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们再听一遍这个对话。

segments.en: And we'll be back in a bit.
segments.cn: 我们稍后再见。

segments.en: Do you have any plans for Veterans Day?
segments.cn: 你有计划庆祝退伍军人日吗？

segments.en: You mean Armistice Day?
segments.cn: 你是说停战日？

segments.en: What are you talking about?
segments.cn: 你在说什么？

segments.en: November 11 is Veterans Day.
segments.cn: 11月11日是退伍军人日。

segments.en: What planet are you from?
segments.cn: 你来自哪个星球？

segments.en: Well, as you know, on November 11, the Allies signed a peace treaty with the Germans, also known as the Armistice Treaty.
segments.cn: 嗯，正如你所知，11月11日，盟军与德国签署了和平条约，也称为停战条约。

segments.en: This marked the end of World War One and many countries around the world commemorated this date under names such as Remembrance Day.
segments.cn: 这标志着第一次世界大战的结束，世界许多国家纪念这个日期，称之为纪念日。

segments.en: In Poland, it's their Independence Day.
segments.cn: 在波兰，这是他们的独立日。

segments.en: There's a lot going on around the world on this day.
segments.cn: 这一天，世界各地发生了很多事情。

segments.en: Wow, I didn't know.
segments.cn: 哇，我不知道。

segments.en: Probably because I flunked history in school.
segments.cn: 可能是因为我在学校历史课不及格。

segments.en: All right, so Veterans Day, it's a big deal in the United States, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，所以退伍军人日在美国是个大事，对吧？

segments.en: It's a very big deal.
segments.cn: 这是个非常重要的日子。

segments.en: There's a parade.
segments.cn: 有游行。

segments.en: Yeah, in most cities in the country, there are parades.
segments.cn: 是的，在全国大多数城市都有游行。

segments.en: And when I was in school, we had to play music because I was in band.
segments.cn: 当我在学校时，我们必须演奏音乐，因为我在乐队里。

segments.en: We used to play music for the veterans and we go to the cemetery and play Taps.
segments.cn: 我们曾为退伍军人演奏音乐，然后去墓地演奏哀乐。

segments.en: Oh no, we didn't play Taps.
segments.cn: 哦不，我们没有演奏哀乐。

segments.en: That's like the funeral song?
segments.cn: 那是葬礼曲吗？

segments.en: Yeah, we would play funeral songs and taps for the local veterans who will be respecting and commemorating fallen soldiers.
segments.cn: 是的，我们会为当地的退伍军人演奏葬礼曲和哀乐，以尊重和纪念阵亡的士兵。

segments.en: Wow, and the president talks as well like on national TV.
segments.cn: 哇，总统也会在全国电视上讲话。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: All right, so it's very interesting, especially the history lesson, the fact that on November, I think it's called 11-11-11, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，所以这非常有趣，尤其是历史课，11月，我想它被称为11-11-11，对吧？

segments.en: November 11th, at 11 o'clock, they signed this armistice treaty.
segments.cn: 11月11日，11点钟，他们签署了这个停战条约。

segments.en: And that was in 1918.
segments.cn: 那是在1918年。

segments.en: So this is World War I.
segments.cn: 所以这是第一次世界大战。

segments.en: We're talking about when the world had never really seen fighting like this before.
segments.cn: 我们在谈论的是世界从未见过这样的战斗。

segments.en: And so everyone was just relieved when what they called the Great War was finally over.
segments.cn: 所以当他们称之为伟大战争时，大家都松了一口气。

segments.en: It's a very interesting history lesson.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常有趣的历史课。

segments.en: So I'm sure many people have some opinions on this, so we would be glad to hear it from you on our website at EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 我相信很多人对此有一些看法，所以我们很高兴在我们的网站EnglishPod.com听到你的意见。

segments.en: You can also leave questions or comments, and we'll see you guys there.
segments.cn: 你也可以留下问题或评论，我们会在那里见到你。

segments.en: And let us know, do you celebrate this holiday in your country?
segments.cn: 让我们知道，你们在你们的国家庆祝这个节日吗？

segments.en: Yep.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: Until next time, bye everyone.
segments.cn: 下次见，大家再见。
